answers.author: Kenneth Decker
answers.text:
The policy of the county where I currently work is to maintain an unrestricted general reserve balance of at least 10 percent of annual operating expenses.  This is in line with GFOA, i.e., "the GFOA recommends, at a minimum, that general-purpose governments, regardless of size, incorporate in its financial policies that unrestricted fund balance in their general fund be no less than two months of regular general fund operating revenues or regular general fund operating expenditures."

text:
There have been frequently asked questions about what is an acceptable reserve or "rainy day fund" account per centage in the budget for a city of 50 sq. miles and 48,000 people.
Florida has its share of hurricanes.  I know that it varies, but what would be an average standard.
Any ideas?
title: Former Deputy Mayor, City of Bonita Springs, Fl.
